cdata.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 170, Number 110 (Tuesday, July 2, 2024)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Ms. NORTON:H.R. 8927.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:clause 17 of section 8 of article I of the ConstitutionThe single subject of this legislation is:This bill would repeal the authority of the U.S. GovernmentAccountability Office over the District of Columbia.[Page H4452]

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Accountability.
Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR E687)

bill.title: District of Columbia Government Accountability Office Home Rule Act

item.title: District of Columbia Government Accountability Office Home Rule Act
District of Columbia Government Accountability Office Home Rule Act
To amend title 31, United States Code, to repeal the authorities of the Government Accountability Office with respect to the District of Columbia government, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Accountability.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
